page.title: 11St Giles Church, Great Orton
page.content: St Giles Church is the only church with that name in the diocese of Cumbria. The church, built in 1098 is of stone which would be cut and shaped before delivery. Some of the stones were taken from the Roman Wall. The outside walls are straight but the inner walls lean outwards giving it an arc shape. The west end of the church was once the school. Originally the patron saint was St Kentigern but in 1300 it was discovered the church was dedicated to St Giles. There are lovely stained glass windows to the memory of both saints. The rector showed us the service book which is a record of services held in the church; the baptismal book,& the wedding & funeral records.The registers date from 1586, althoughthere is a break from 1639-1665.During the Civil War records were buried in a field.
